programme.title: Deck the Walls

programme.desc: Sophia is a third wheel when Dorothy and her new boyfriend plan a trip without her.

programme.desc: Sophia encourages Dorothy and Stan to pretend they are still married, at least until Sophia's clergyman brother leaves town.

programme.desc: When Kyra passes her driving test, Barbra Jean makes her sign a safety contract and provides her with a cell phone that contains a hidden GPS chip.

programme.title: Reba
programme.desc: Brock volunteers to be a football coach and encourages Jake to try out for the team, so Reba persuades Van to train him for the tryouts.

programme.title: Reba
programme.desc: Against her better judgment, Reba gives in to Cheyenne's pleas and hires the unemployed Van as her assistant, only to be surprised when he sells the house she has been trying to unload for weeks.

programme.desc: Reba takes it upon herself to keep Van sober when she suspects he has a drinking problem; Kyra and her band are invited to perform at a USO event for soldiers leaving for Iraq.

programme.desc: Frasier catches his professional mentor (Rene Auberjonois) in a compromising position; Niles agrees to meet with Daphne's psychic evaluator (Fisher Stevens).

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Frasier escorts Lana (Jean Smart) to a surprise birthday party while trying to woo her friend (Patricia Clarkson).

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Frasier comforts a man (Patrick Breen) whose wife abandoned him and took their four children with her.

programme.desc: Carla's low estimation of Eddie's estate leads her to agree to a 50-50 split with his other widow (Anne De Salvo).

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Cheers once again lags behind in the annual St. Patrick's Day practical joke contest.

programme.title: Reba
programme.desc: Cheyenne and Van must run interference at a client party after Reba takes a pill, by mistake, that will make her violently ill if she drinks alcohol.

programme.title: Reba
programme.desc: When Barbra Jean signs Reba up for an online dating service, Reba winds up dating a mystery man and spending less time with the family.

programme.title: Reba
programme.desc: When Reba teams up with Van to invest in real estate, he buys an uninspected house, which prompts her to want out of their partnership.

programme.title: Reba
programme.desc: Cheyenne asks Reba to talk some sense into Van when he stops going to church, but when Reba's efforts fail, she takes her problem straight to the church's handsome new minister (Patrick Fabian).

programme.desc: When her fiance (Wes Brown) receives a job offer, a woman (Brooke D'Orsay) must suddenly plan her wedding in three weeks.

programme.desc: The owner of a bookstore butts heads with an architect who plans on renovating the neighborhood.

programme.desc: A local chocolatier is rumored to have the secret recipe to finding true love on Valentine's Day, drawing in a television reporter to investigate.

programme.title: Marry Go Round
programme.desc: Abby is a successful executive who's moving to Paris and planning to marry Edward. Life is perfect until she learns her divorce to her high school sweetheart, Luke, is not exactly official.

programme.title: Falling in Love in Niagara
programme.desc: When her fiance leaves her right before the wedding, Madeline goes to Niagara Falls to honeymoon without him. She soon finds new love while reconnecting with her adventurous side.

programme.title: The 27-Hour Day
programme.desc: Taking a break from her wellness empire, an entrepreneur develops a budding romance with a handsome man at a relaxing retreat.

programme.title: Love on the Danube: Love Song
programme.desc: A daughter traveling with her widowed mother and a son traveling with his widower father meet on a cruise; the two decide that their musical parents would make the perfect couple try to engineer a romance only to falling in love themselves.

programme.desc: Stella designs hats and fascinators for socialite Rosalind and meets her son Christian who's training a horse to compete in the Louisville Derby.

programme.desc: The family learns that Cheyenne no longer wishes to pursue a career in dentistry after she turns down Brock's offer to intern at his office; Barbara Jean is called for jury duty.

programme.desc: A single mother (Nikki DeLoach) reinvents her struggling diner while spending time with a former high-school boyfriend (Andrew W. Walker) who's now a superstar baseball player.
